address: 65 Airport Blvd #036-142 Terminal 3 Singapore 819663 Singapore
comment: This is a place awesome... coffee amazing and service impeccable.. if your ever in the Beautiful Singapore Airport I come have a cup

address: 65 Airport Blvd #036-142 Terminal 3 Singapore 819663 Singapore
comment: Glad to have one of my favourite places to eat has arrived in Singapore. Prices are okay and the food quality is up to standard. Unfortunately it has one of the worst, if not the worst, service I have ever had in my entire life. The gay server was very rude.

address: 65 Airport Blvd #036-142 Terminal 3 Singapore 819663 Singapore
comment: my go to place in Changi Airport.great sandwiches that beats the blue from sitting in a tiny economic seat with airline food.fresh ingredients and good buns, the cookies a d coffee are also good

address: 354 Joo Chiat Road Singapore 427600 Singapore
comment: I don't eat a lot of prawn noodle, but after trying this stall I'm reluctant to try anyone else.* Though some might find this a bit pricy ($8 for a regular size, and at most, $13 for a large size bowl with big prawns) the quality is there. I don't exactly know what goes in the broth, but it's not very watery. Rather, it has a good mix of prawn, pork, and garlic flavour. My favourite part is the bits of pork crackling that's thrown in. They are the juiciest, fattiest pieces and really make the dish. I like how you can throw in some chili/vinegar to cut through the heavy flavours.One of my favourite outdoor stalls in SG!--*But feel free to trick me by saying "Let's grab some chendol" and then take me to your fave prawn noodle spot, plop a bowl in front of me, and demand that I eat it and like it OR ELSE.

address: 354 Joo Chiat Road Singapore 427600 Singapore
comment: It's a total rip of for a bowl of $8 prawn noodle in Singapore with three mini shrimps and two think slick of pork . Taste is mediocre and forgettable , you can taste better one in blanco court prawn noodle in Beach road  or the nearby prawn noodle place in Still road where $8 can give you jumbo prawn . Totally not worth to come here . Save yourself the money and time.

address: 354 Joo Chiat Road Singapore 427600 Singapore
comment: Da Dong was sold out before 12.30 p.m. the last 2 Saturdays. Today they have prawns but no pork ribs. Soup is a bit too sweet.Verdict: Nice but not great. River South (Hoe Nam) Prawns Noodles tastes better to me.

address: 354 Joo Chiat Road Singapore 427600 Singapore
comment: My go to prawn mee store is closed for three weeks for the lunar new year, so I have to look for another shop to feed my craving for prawn mee with large prawns. Glad I took a chance to had breakfast here. The broth is very good (not as good as my usual go to shop), second best. Another plus is the fresh made crispy pork lard bits. I asked for extra and was given more than I expected. Service was good too. My sister and I only ordered one bowl as we just wanted to taste if it is good, as we had already had some breakfast at another shop down the street. The gentleman gave us two empty bowls so that we could split the food.Definitely will come back for more.

address: 354 Joo Chiat Road Singapore 427600 Singapore
comment: At 10am on a Sat, they are already fairly busy but the wait is not bad (10mins). As always their soup is excellent. We had the dry noodles and it came with some sambal premixed in the sauce. A little too spicy for kids but not so for anyone who is used to spicy food. Large portion can easily be eaten by hungry adult. Like that the shrimp are peeled and halved but not deveined.

address: 354 Joo Chiat Road Singapore 427600 Singapore
comment: This place has pretty darn good prawn noodles. The thing is, even though you order a large, you might end up ordering 3 bowls in total. A large isn't really a large. More like a small. Makes you wonder how big a regular size is. It's 10 dollars per bowl so it isn't really cheap compared to other hawker-like places.

address: 354 Joo Chiat Road Singapore 427600 Singapore
comment: Ahh, Prawn Noodles! A simple, yet beautiful dish. Located on the corner of Joo Chiat Road and Marshall Lane, Da Dong Prawn Noodles delivers one of the Best Prawn Noodles in the area, if not on the entire isling. Assessing the quality and taste of Prawn Noodles is often quite difficult. Frankly, they all have that shrimpy taste with a cooked garlic finish. In my opinion, what separates a so so prawn noodls from a fantastic one is: (i) the flavour, (ii) quality of the broth and (iii) the freshness of the prawn.Da Dong Prawn delivers all of these and more. The broth is rich in flavour and explodes in your mouth. The uncle even makes it an emphasis (a sign) that he doesn't re-fill the soup as it would dilute the flavours. Wow, that's quality. Overall, simply a fantastic prawn noodles. It is a little on the pricier side for prawn noodles, but hey, prawn noodles are a cheap comfort food anyways. :D

address: 354 Joo Chiat Road Singapore 427600 Singapore
comment: Arrived here at 08:45 hours . I ordered the Regular Size prawn noodles(5 sing). The aroma of prawns filled the air . One sip of this soup and WOWZERRRR's !!!!!!  The prawn broth was soooo intense . Mix in some chili's and.......WooooHooooo, a mouth full of fireworks. Yes , it's that good. The slow braised pork ribs gave the broth its savoriness . Such a simple, but amazing dish. The regular size leaves you craving for more, but in Singapore ; there's more phenomenal foods to try. Thank you Mr. Prawn Noodle Master

address: 354 Joo Chiat Road Singapore 427600 Singapore
comment: I stumbled across Mellvin Coffee Shop and found that everyone was having prawn noodles. I took this as a sign that the prawn noodles must be good, so we decided to give it a try. And indeed, I think this ranks among the best prawn mee that I have had. The soup is full of flavour. The prawns were fresh and juicy. The pork slices were cooked just right.Unfortunately, I came late on a Thursday afternoon around 1.30pm and he was out of pork ribs, so it was just regular prawn mee.A small bowl is $5, a regular bowl is $8, and a large bowl is $10.We had a regular bowl of prawn mee, and although I appreciate the extra soup, I think we could have gone for the small bowl instead.He also sells prawn noodles with large prawns. They cost slightly more at $9 for a regular sized bowl.

address: 354 Joo Chiat Road Singapore 427600 Singapore
comment: Uncle Ah Hoi is perhaps the most dedicated specialist whose hawker fare is not the least diluted by the crowd flocking over to his stall. Previously at Farrer, he told me that he only serves what's the best, and on my first visit, recommended I have a bowl of prawn mee soup. Carpark is readily available across the coffeeshop or along the road so as I shifted my car to a proper lot, uncle prepared a bowl and then urged me to eat it quick and not worry about paying first. The first sip of the soup, I was sold and in love. The sweetness of the prawn broth with the savouriness of garlic in it makes it simple and addictive. He gives 3 pieces of prawn and slices of lean pork meat along with a regular bowl, and nothing to complain. The sign at his stall states that he cannot top up soup because it will compromise the flavour if he did that. I found it bizarre that such after such a big bowl, anyone would want more, but when I was down to my last sip, I knew I was tempted to ask for more. Priced really fairly at $5 a bowl, I am glad for the natural tasting soup, made with love from the way uncle speaks of his food.He closes on Tuesdays, but otherwise, drop by before 2pm and you should be lucky enough to get a bowl!

address: 354 Joo Chiat Road Singapore 427600 Singapore
comment: This is "confirmed" to be the best prawn noodles you can get in Singapore (my humble opinion of course). The soup is amazingly fragrant and prawns they throw in is generous i.e. big and fresh. A bit pricey but worth every cent. I always go for the big pork rib at $10. Do go early on weekends because he always sells out by 1pm.

address: 80 Airport Boulevard Changi Airport Terminal 1 Singapore 819642 Singapore
comment: I toured all three terminals surveying my food options before finding Sushi Burrito. As soon as I saw it, I had to have it. I'm obsessed with Sushirrito in the Bay Area and always order a sushi burrito when it's available. I was excited at first to see they had very similar rolls like Salmon Samba and Geishas Kiss, though under different names. I should have been deterred by the first reviewer, but I did not heed those wise words, and my excitement diminished when I realized they wouldn't make me a fresh sushi burrito. All the rolls are displayed as halves, so I thought maybe if I ordered a full roll they'd make me new one (nope, just two halves). And of course, it tasted like it's been sitting around for a while. Sushirrito tells you it's best enjoyed immediately, and I think that's true with any sushi burrito. Moist seaweed just doesn't stay good for long. Overall, not terrible, but not worth it.

address: 80 Airport Boulevard Changi Airport Terminal 1 Singapore 819642 Singapore
comment: Meh. The sushi burrito is alright. I've had better and would not recommend this. They have a display of their various sushi burrito options on the window for you to choose from. You can either get a half burrito or full burrito. The rice was bland and the veggies tasted old (not fresh). I  got the rainbow shrimp burrito, which consisted of prawn tempura. However the prawn tempura was mushy and soft on the outside. You can tell that the burrito had been sitting out for a while and not fresh. FYI: It's located at the Changi Airport in the Terminal 1 departure gate near gate C.

address: 80 Airport Boulevard Changi Airport Terminal 1 Singapore 819642 Singapore
comment: This place have fancy looking menu and vibrant colored sushi burritos staring at you through the glass display casing. That is about it. If you want sushi, go get a sushi. If you want a burrito, sorry, you need to get this before coming to the airport. Sushi burrito is basically like an uncut sushi roll with more ingredients. While that can sound attractive because hei, who doesn't like sushi?, but Sushi Burrito did it completely all wrong. I tried their unagi sushi burrito. The amount of unagi is like the amount you would get on 4 pieces of unagi sushi while the rice and fillers would make maybe 4 sets of sushi roll (4 x 6/8 of your regular sushi!). What are the fillers? Cucumbers, pickled veggies, onions and LOTS of rice. If I want my veggies, I would go get myself a bowl of salad. Lots of veggies maybe good for you but I paid to get a meal where I can taste unagi in most of my bites. Nope. It was mostly rice and veggies. For the price, I would not recommend this place. On the good side, their packaging is very handy for a quick grab and it is a healthy option.

address: 80 Airport Boulevard Changi Airport Terminal 1 Singapore 819642 Singapore
comment: Was very excited to try out a local sushiritto concept. But the burrito did not meet my expectations. Was at the branch early in the morning (7am) before my flight and ordered the soft shell crab burrito. The crab was little and hard. Ratio of veggies to meat was 90:10. Could definitely use more meat at this price.

address: 80 Airport Boulevard Changi Airport Terminal 1 Singapore 819642 Singapore
comment: I have been wanting to try out Sushi Burrito since I am a huge fan of Sushiritto in San Francisco. But i wont compare them because they are different although they have similar appearance.I was a bit skeptical since I heard a lot of my friends that Sushi Burrito is just so-so.  The first bite, I tried to compare it with what I had in SF. But i began to remove those thought as soon as I had my second bite. They are different. It taste so good and still fresh although i doubt it when i arrive at the stall and looking at those sushiburrito that already displayed. They just took those premade sushi and served it. Although it is still good, i wish they can make it fresh. Idk how it works for people who order half size. Maybe they will make the fresh version of that? Perhaps. So i just want to conclude my review that Sushi Burrito is a better version of handroll sushi that i usually have. It taste better than normal sushi or hand roll. It has good appearance. But perhaps, maybe more experimental flavor/sauce in the future. Note: the wasabi burned me

address: Pasir Ris Park 133 Pasir Ris Road, Pasir Ris Park, Carpark E Singapore 519149 Singapore
comment: Nice view, nice food and great service. A little rowdy with smoking teenagers on Friday night's though, other than that, all is great!

address: 78 Airport Blvd #02-227, 228, 229 Singapore 819666 Singapore
comment: Having dined in muji cafe in the yuracho location in Tokyo, this one is totally different......The cake was so so and a bit dry.... I would not come again.  The selection is quite limited too .....I guess so too, why the hell I come to Singapore and try to eat Japanese food???  :(

address: 681 Punggol Dr #01-15 Singapore 821669 Singapore
comment: Their frog leg soup is a must order! Very herbal-y. Just wished they boiled their red dates longer in the soup as it was too hard and kinda inedible. The flavour of the red dates doesn't absorb into the soup then whats the point?Anyways I made feedback a few times on their super wet chopsticks. Nothing was done. Other than that still a great place to dine at.

address: 681 Punggol Dr #01-15 Singapore 821669 Singapore
comment: Not the best but not too bad. Price is affordable. Great place for family with kids. 五香quite okSesame chicken okVegetables ok

address: 484 Changi Road Singapore 419896 Singapore
comment: This is my 4th stop of the day on 17th Jan 2015.Was introduced to this place by Melissa Y. It is not too far from the Kembangan MRT and you could probably see the signboard from afar.Came here as Mel had purchased 2 Sugar coupons for the waffles and we decided to try the waffles with Hokkaido Milk & Honey and Figs . We also ordered the B.F.F. 4 types of fries and four types of sauces. The waffle was over-crispy but the ice creams were delicious. It was melting on the tongue after putting it in your mouth. Didn't really like the waffle that much as this time round it was over-cooked.The B.F.F. was interesting mix of fries. I like the truffle fries as it was crunchy but it doesn't have much truffle flavor on it. The wedges and the criss-cut fries were al-right (probably cause I've been eating too much other stuffs before coming here). I didn't try the shoestring fries (Curly fries?). The dips I have no clue what they are besides the tartar sauce.This place is rather cosy and inviting. On the walls it has writings and interesting quotes. Was not as crowded as I thought it maybe especially on a Saturday evening. Definitely a good place to hang out or even board game sessions :)

address: 484 Changi Road Singapore 419896 Singapore
comment: Located along Changi road is Rice & Fries. From what I understand it has opened for over a year now and I have just learnt about this place via the SUGAR app. It is within walking distance of Kembangan MRT. We managed to easily find a parallel parking street parking spot along Changi Road.1. Rack o' Ribs ($22.80)The great BBQ aroma from this dish would make anyone hungry! It was slighly charred to perfection and the meat fell off the bone. For Singapore standards it's pretty good, still nowhere near what I used to eat daily in the States. For $22.80 it's not too pricey, although that's as much as I would ever pay for ribs in Singapore.The meat was juicy and tender. The ribs were well executed with the barbecue sauce over nicely done meat.2. Waffles with Ice Cream ($5.80 each)With the SUGAR app, we managed to buy each waffle with ice cream for about $2 each! But nonetheless even at $5.80 It's still quite reasonable, compared to some cafes that charge like $9 for a whole waffle and ice cream. This is indeed only half a waffle but there's so much to love about this waffle.The waffle is delightfully crispy! It is not the fluffy kind, some online reviewers have mentioned that it tastes like over-cooked waffles or even "burnt". But to me, it was nice and crispy and I like it this way. The chocolate ice cream was a bit bitter, the green tea ice cream was nice and had the legit green tea taste in there. The salted caramel was the sweet ice cream amongst the 3 flavours. The waffle was slightly salty, some of my friends didn't like it so salty, but I felt that it was a good compliment for the salted caramel ice cream, since the ice cream was so sweet. Waffles and ice cream! Who can resist such a great combination of colours and flavours.The food at Rice & Fries may not be super awesome , it's nevertheless tasty and the ambience is very enjoyable. We were the only customers there on a saturday afternoon at 3pm.

address: 484 Changi Road Singapore 419896 Singapore
comment: What I like about this place is; it cover almost everything from western food to alcohol, coffee and tea and including ice cream with waffles. A very nice place to chill out. Surprised is not crowded even during weekend.Why 3 star is because though food is trendy but not really fantastic delicious, however is good enough.

address: 484 Changi Road Singapore 419896 Singapore
comment: Hungry after an errand at Orbea, the bike shop, I decided to give Rice and Fries a try. I wanted something light but couldn't resist the spicy prawn aglio olio. I enjoyed the huge prawns, the pasta slightly above mediocre. Not overly impressed but would give it another shot if I needed food and AC at 4pm again.

address: 484 Changi Road Singapore 419896 Singapore
comment: Must try their lamb shank. Very delicious and roasted with long hours. A good place to chill out with friends as well.

address: 121 Meyer Rd #01-07, The Makena Condo Singapore 437932 Singapore
comment: This is primarily a pizza place, and being a pizza lover, I had to come to this place because I have heard so many good things about the pizza here. I had some difficulty trying to locate this place because it was located in a somewhat hidden place. One of the pizzas that we had was the seafood pizza, which I found to be really delicious! The taste was very savory and the crust was thin and crispy. I personally like the crust to be thin, and pizzas with crusts that are overly thick and floury turn me off.We also had a few other pizzas such as the triple meat pizza and the pepperoni pizza, which were all good but no doubt, the pizza to try here is the seafood pizza. If you want, you could add on a little chili padi for that extra kick.All in all, highly recommended for a pizza joint that arguably beats the mainstream Pizza Hut.

address: 271 Tanjong Katong Road Singapore 437054 Singapore
comment: This place serves old school no-frills char siew (seasoned barbecued pork), roast chicken, roast duck and sio bak (roast pork). The charred fatty cuts of meat are pretty much amazing, and I'm partial to the roast pork and roast chicken. It's also reasonably priced, at around S$4-6 for a packet of chicken rice. Ask for the dark meat (chicken thigh) instead of the leaner cuts. Trust me, it's worth the calories.The stall is located within the coffeeshop named "Keng Bee Restaurant" at the corner of the building facing the Caltex gas station. Seating within the coffeeshop is limited and there's parking at the back. The line is out the door pretty much at lunchtime, so do come early before they sell out.Depending on how long the line is, the guy at the stall might get a little grouchy or impatient with you. I also have to knock them for a less than stellar chilli sauce which is practically watered down beyond recognition.The stall is closed on Tuesdays, and a different hawker helms the evening shift at the same stall, so be aware that the food served might be different at dinner.TLDR; Old school roast chicken and roast pork with charred fatty cuts, reasonably priced but a bad attitude with a long wait. Good, cheap, fast, well you can only pick two!

address: 271 Tanjong Katong Road Singapore 437054 Singapore
comment: This place is seriously underrated. Their charsiew and sio bak are damn awesome and are right up there with the big boys. I only say this as they aren't your usual household name when it comes to roast meats but hey definitely should be!The charsiew has a good balance of caramelised fat and meat. He gives me 2 kinds of charsiew. One more lean and another with the more caramelised note. The internationally charred bits of skin of the charsiew actually held a crunch.The sio bak is by far the BEST I've had in singapore. I dare put my name on the line for this one. The crackling, meat and fat are just crispy HEAVEN in your mouth. Out of all of Singapore... none can match the price and quality of this stall. It's mad.4.9/5 STARS

address: 271 Tanjong Katong Road Singapore 437054 Singapore
comment: I'm going to cry, this place is SOOOO good. The name Nan Xiang Chicken Rice is misleading because this stall specializes in Roast Pork and Roast Duck.Let me start and end with the Roast Pork. WOW, I mean wow! It's got three layers of heaven: (i) juicy inside, (ii) marbled fatty area  and (iii) a crunchy skin. However, what separates this Char Siew vs. others is that the skin has got a serious Smokey Finish. The best part of all, the smokey flavour sticks in your mouth up until you eventually brush your teeth! :D   Be sure to bring your mints, if you plan to go out on a date afterwards. Word of Advice: To best enjoy the roast pork, DO NOT put any sauce on top. It will dilute the flavor. However, be sure to ask the uncle to put sauce on top of the rice. The separation of rice with sauce and the roast pork is just a perfect complement.  Lines are obviously long, Locals already know this little secret. The Uncle is as cool as cucumber and has this air of confidence that "yeah, i'm the man and what I'm serving you is the da bomb diggity!"    Badda bing Badda boom and there you have it. The best Roast Pork on the Red Dot bar none!

address: 271 Tanjong Katong Road Singapore 437054 Singapore
comment: Sadly standard have dropped but the attitude the same - bad.  Condiments ginger water chilli water :)

address: 271 Tanjong Katong Road Singapore 437054 Singapore
comment: This place is really a heaven-sent for meat lovers! Their char siew just feels so thick and the bite is just right. Not too dry, not too wet but juicy enough to wake up your senses of indulgence. The roasted pork is also made just fine, so fine. The crispy part and the fatty part and the meaty part just work out so well in your mouth. Unbelievable and indescribable.I didn't get to try the chicken and duck but I heard they are most famous for their duck. Just by trying the two meats above already lets them deserve the highest rating. I look forward to trying their duck and update this review but what a splendid meal of meat over here! Come on all carnivores, over here!

address: 271 Tanjong Katong Road Singapore 437054 Singapore
comment: I was hungry, and running late for a meeting in the area, so I thought I'd stop here for a quick lunch... And my decision was made easier by the fact that there wasn't anything in the coffee shop to eat at 2pm, save the very last bits of char siew, siew yoke and some chicken breast... So I got a plate of char siew + siew yoke rice, and sat down to wolf it down.Fate intervened of course, and uncle had generously slapped on my plate some rough cut meats, liberally marbled with soft, juicy fat. As I took a second to admire his handiwork before shovelling it into my now ravenous mouth-hole, I realised the beauty in what lay before me - the rough cut meant he did not stinge on razor-thin slivers, and the chunkier segments offered more bite and flavour, so I could really experience the char in his char siew.Though I did savour each tasty morsel, it was gone too soon, and all I had left was the simple soup to end what was a very tasty meal for just three dollars. Who'd thought you could find such a gem?

address: 271 Tanjong Katong Road Singapore 437054 Singapore
comment: This is a review of a lunch with a colleague at Nan Xiang Chicken Rice.tinyurl.com/cfer3ssWe were planning on going to a different spot.  But when we arrived, we changed our mind.  My colleague knew of Nan Xiang Chicken Rice and suggested we go there.The staff was terse but professional.The space is neat and clean enough.  It certainly will not send anyone running.tinyurl.com/d7hsfnoNan Xiang is reallyabout the food.  In that, they deliver.  Boy, do they deliver!Chicken rice with roast pork and char siew - This was a very tasty plate of food.  It was all good. The chicken, the roast pork, the char siew - mmm mmm good.  The rice was perfectly prepared.  The chicken was so tender.  Then you get the saltiness of the pork.  Needless to say, we left nothing on the plate.tinyurl.com/cvlw6qvI did not pay for this meal.  Great food, free food - You can't beat that.  The lime juice from the nearby stall was quite good and quite large.tinyurl.com/d53kzcoOverall - If you just want some really good chicken rice with some pork, then this is the place.  It is worth a little trip to visit.

address: 271 Tanjong Katong Road Singapore 437054 Singapore
comment: I tapaoed this home and ate it three hours later for supper.The roast pork/charsiew tastes good even when cold. There's like three layers though not to be confused with the three-layered pork (San chen rou) which has a middle layer of pure fats.This charsiew is awesome and it's almost an art to see the stall owner finely slice the meat in front of you, then drizzle it with some sauce and pack it up for you.Now I know why the reviews of this place is so positive. Tried the chicken rice like 5 years ago, but kinda forgot how it tastes. Will come back again for chicken rice add charsiew/roast pork!

address: 271 Tanjong Katong Road Singapore 437054 Singapore
comment: One of the best roast chicken in Singapore - not dry but juicy. I love the roast pork as well - it is crisp and marbled with enough fat.I usually order the chicken and the roast pork but even the char siew is good but there is only this much space in my stomach :)

address: 6 Changi Business Park Ave 2 #01-21 Tampines, Singapore Singapore
comment: The atmosphere at Mikawa is delightful.  The peaceful ambiance, stone accents and clean, crispness provide a comfort that I've rarely seen duplicated at other overseas Japanese establishments.Service was prompt and attentive but not overly so.The sushi was fine, though a little heavy on the fish eggs for my tastes; even the California roll featured them.  The taste was just a little off, though not bad in any way.  While Mikawa was a nice enough restaurant, I don't know that it is somewhere I would necessarily recommend to a visitor.

address: 6 Changi Business Park Ave 2 #01-21 Tampines, Singapore Singapore
comment: This Japanese restuarant had been around for one year and this is the first time we discover it. It served a wide range of Japanese food like Sashimi, sushi, maki mono, agemono, teppanyaki, yakimono, sukiyaki and noodles.  We tried their Omakase dinner as they got fresh shipment arrived that day.  It very fresh and delicious and we enjoyed a lot.   We like the best is the 三合饭 which is not in the menu.  It don with chopped salmon, tuna belly, salmon roe and sea urchin roe.  贅沢 "Zeitaku" translated as luxury and extravagance.   The otoro is also equally good and really melt in your mouth

address: 6 Changi Business Park Ave 2 #01-21 Tampines, Singapore Singapore
comment: This is an okay place. I didn't order anything fancy but I think it's better done elsewhere for this particular food(saboten). Venue is so so in decor and not a fan how cold this place is. Is it for the sushi? I don't like rushing to eat my food but it's losing optimal temp very quickly. Service is nice though.

address: 6 Changi Business Park Ave 2 #01-21 Tampines, Singapore Singapore
comment: For the past two years, I have been coming To Mikawa every time I come to Singapore for business which is about 4 times a year. I also held business lunches often. Today, as usual I ordered chef's special sashimi, S$45. In the past, I could tell the chef took pride in the arrangement and choices. I never got the same choices but never was disappointed either until today. Today, I got 5 pieces of typical fish with a scoop of ikura. I asked if chef changed and got told a new chef took over. I guess, I won't be coming back to Mikawa anymore.

address: 333 Joo Chiat Rd Singapore 427588 Singapore
comment: Value for money budget steak with all you can eat salad and fries.Despite the Brazilian name, it's more of a steak frites place. The owners of this restaurant are French. The menu is simple, S$19.90 gets you a sirloin and unlimited fries and salad. To upsize your steak, pay $5 extra.By all means it's not the best steak, you get what you pay for, really. Beef quality is only a small notch above Aston's or Jack's place. Fries are crispy out of the fryer, and for the salad, you get butter lettuce instead of iceberg lettuce. If you're in the mood, they do serve caipirinhas. :)4 stars cos it's value for money, but don't come in here expecting Morton's or Ruth's Chris. The food quality is only 3, but on a day when you crave steak, it's fine, really.

address: 333 Joo Chiat Rd Singapore 427588 Singapore
comment: I'm really really surprised that this place hasn't gotten more notoriety on Yelp.  Braseiro is a fantastic French grill in the the heart of Joo Chiat Road. The best deal on the menu is easily the signature Meat (you are getting the steak, no questions asked) served with an UNLIMITED supply of French fries and fresh lettuce.  P.S I wish they replaced the French fries with rice, kidding! Clearly, this is not an Asian restaurant :-)For doneness of my meat, I chose medium-rare. The rib eye steak came out fantastic. I had no idea the French could grill! You also have the option of three sauces: mango, mustard and chipotle to mix with your steak and fries. Don't fret, if there is no seating space on the first floor. There is a large 2nd floor with another set of 8 dinning tables or more. it's a bit neat to see expats living in the neighborhood playing a card game of sorts on the second floor during the evening. The big surprise is that there is a beautiful terrace in the back that accommodates 20 or more people, if you are keen for a fun night amongst friends under neath the stars and in an enclosed outdoor setting.Four stars for the price - $20 for char grilled steak and unlimited homemade fries and the fact you won't find this type of restaurant anywhere else on Joo Chiat or anywhere else on the East Coast for that matter.

address: 333 Joo Chiat Rd Singapore 427588 Singapore
comment: I firmly believe that what is cheap is not necessarily bad and what is expensive is not necessarily good. At $19.90 a steak I was hoping for adequacy. Did not get it. Soggy fries, gristly steak. About 30% was gristle. We complained, no one cared. Nail on the coffin? The lava cake was cold in the centre. I applaud the chilli mustard. It's a busy restaurant. I wish them well.

address: 333 Joo Chiat Rd Singapore 427588 Singapore
comment: Thought it would be weak, but not bad for a French style brasserie. Not exactly Entrecote, but in that similar style. Steak was good, not awesome. Cooked perfect to temp. Fondue was really just melted Brie, but was very tasty and baguette bread was delightful. Service was attentive but not annoying. Fries were good, but I'm not a fan of them. Wine selection was weak, but our Chianti was great. Dessert was a chocolate mousse that was good. Downstairs is limited seating but there's more room upstairs. Definitely recommend for a taste.

address: 333 Joo Chiat Rd Singapore 427588 Singapore
user_location: New Port Richey, Tampa Bay, FL
comment: My wife and I went to Braseiro yesterday. It was a great experience. We were greeted and served by the owner. He took great care of us, and the food was good. I like the vibe in the restaurant with the decor and the music also, it is very laid back and not uptight like more formal places that serve steak. The steak was good, the fries were good, the cheese fondue and desert were also good, but what we enjoyed the most is our conversation with the owner. We had a great time!

address: 333 Joo Chiat Rd Singapore 427588 Singapore
comment: I could eat here EVERYDAY!! My favorite place to eat on Joo Chait!  I love Braseiro!! Ran by a young couple, you really  feel like you are going to a friends house for some amazing BBQ. The prices are great and the meat is always cooked to perfection! Ohhhh... And free flow salad and fries, what more do I need to say!

address: 333 Joo Chiat Rd Singapore 427588 Singapore
comment: Ordered 3 steaks and 1 chicken. Chicken is good & tasty. 1 piece of steak has too much gristle. The other 2 are ok. Ok quality, I went there with higher expectations because of the 4 stars, but not expecting Ruth's Chris level. Came out disappointed. Gave us a tiny bowl of salad for 4 person though can ask for more. Fries are too soggy. Won't be back again for sure

address: 333 Joo Chiat Rd Singapore 427588 Singapore
comment: Decent steak with free flow of fries (super addictive) and salad. Nice chill out place and very good service given that I only see the owner serving!! Always checking each table timely and we don't really have to call him to get something or to be served.

address: 333 Joo Chiat Rd Singapore 427588 Singapore
comment: Love love LOVE this place! Found it online while in Singapore. My mum and I were craving a steak. We took an Uber over to Braseiro. 2 storey little place, cute terrace on the second floor. The owner was so sweet...she is french, she and her boyfriend opened the restaurant, combining elements of french food (think steak frits in a Paris brasserie) and Brazilian ( think perfect Caipirinha in a bar in Rio). The steak was cooked perfectly..the homemade fries were to die for. Did I mention how delicious the Caipirinhas are?? Now for the kicker: $19.90 for the 200g steak and the fries and salad are bottomless! So glad we came here...you should too!!

address: 333 Joo Chiat Rd Singapore 427588 Singapore
comment: I really want this place to succeed. In a neighbourhood overwhelmed with burgers, fish and chips, EPL, and $15 beers, this is a welcome alternative. Prices are almost suspiciously reasonable for an area that seems to try its hardest to out-expensive Holland Village. The menu is simple and we like that: Choose your meat, and get unlimited fries and salad with it. Don't be fooled by the small downstairs space, they have an upstairs, both indoors with aircon as well as a small roof terrace. Upstairs is quieter, Joo Chiat isn't exactly a pedestrian zone. Owners and staff are nice and helpful and give the place a personal touch. Food is good. Another plus: They're open until late, including the kitchen. I believe there's food until midnight. There's many food choices in this part of town, but this brings something new to the mix.

address: 333 Joo Chiat Rd Singapore 427588 Singapore
comment: Best rapport price/quality for a red meat restaurant in Singapore, extra !This restaurant, just opened recently in a shophouse in the center of joochiat.IF you go there, it's for meat, and eat a really good steak with french fries and salad free flow.For chicken lover, there is also but according to me, best to order red meat.Price are affordable (less than 30sgd) and you can choose your meat size (200/300/400 g) and how it will be cook, and are includ GST.On the final bill, no GST, only service charge add.Don't think you go there and find the same food as other meat restaurant like Ashton (serving steak too cook and hard). Here all the meat is very tender and the cooking as requested.To recommend

address: 11 Tanjong Katong Road OneKM Mall #02-21/22 Singapore 437157 Singapore
comment: I love their collagen broth! Super rich and flavorful. Service here is pretty good, although I do find the bowing a little too excessive :/ The fried beancurd skin is delicious - simply dip it into the broth for 2 seconds for the perfect texture!PS. Make sure you make a reservation as they limit you to 90min of dining time. Recommended!

address: 11 Tanjong Katong Road OneKM Mall #02-21/22 Singapore 437157 Singapore
comment: I'm appalled by the nonchalant nature of the wait staffs! They were like "whatever" upon us alerting them to a LIVE CRAWLING COCKROACH, immediately when we were being seated! They did not even offer to switch our table immediately or anywhere close to being apologetic....right about then, another group of diners came in and was as shocked as we were! I RARELY make a fuss or "complained" about things in a restaurant unless it's HEALTH RELATED. My standards are raised even further as we are or were about to  dine in a Paradise Group's chain of restaurants! Please note this is an unbiased review as I'm a member of the Paradise Group patrons, not limited to, of course. Sadly, I'll never stepped foot in that "beauty in the pot" located in Kinex ever again! Please see attached pic...video's available upon request as well.

address: 11 Tanjong Katong Road OneKM Mall #02-21/22 Singapore 437157 Singapore
comment: When my friend and I rocked up on a Saturday evening they quoted us 4 hours waiting time. However, my friend charmed the waitress in giving us an earlier slot but in the end, the wait was still 1 hour.We went for the double pot and I found the broth quite thick and filling (probably the collagen). In the end, I believe I prefer the regular broth they have at other steamboat places.The food was ok but nothing spectacular, I found the beef a bit disappointing in quality but the pork was quite good. The pork balls with cheesy filling were my fave.Overall, we spend around 60$ a person which I found a lot for an average hotpot place. Not really worth the wait or the money.... there are other cheaper and better places to get your hot pot fix!

address: 11 Tanjong Katong Road OneKM Mall #02-21/22 Singapore 437157 Singapore
comment: This is a MUST TRY if you are a steamboat fan. Particularly if you are a lady, or who enjoys the thick collagen soups, you have to come. Be prepared to make a well-advanced reservation as the place is super packed each time I tried to make a booking.The soup itself is the main star. All the other dishes were decent, if not a little expensive. But good quality definitely so at least your money would be well spent.I tried the special fish tofu - interesting and delicious. The shabu pork and beef were good as well!

address: 11 Tanjong Katong Road OneKM Mall #02-21/22 Singapore 437157 Singapore
comment: The best hotpot! Everything is fresh and the fried beancurd skin is the must try!

address: 11 Tanjong Katong Road OneKM Mall #02-21/22 Singapore 437157 Singapore
comment: The soup is amazing. Wonderful service. I'll definitely come back here, despite the LONG wait for a table.About 50-60 per person, which makes this kinda pricey for hot pot, but for its taste blast, totally worth it.

address: 11 Tanjong Katong Road OneKM Mall #02-21/22 Singapore 437157 Singapore
comment: Great food and service. Nice environment and suitable for families. The food is nicely placed and soup tasty. Prices are on the high side. It is opened till 1am! However, I won't not recommend for group gatherings or outings. Reason being the restaurant has a 90min dining time limit. Imagine finding another place to talk when the time runs out...

address: 11 Tanjong Katong Road OneKM Mall #02-21/22 Singapore 437157 Singapore
comment: The worst service I ever experienced in my life. I will never ever give a bad review but this place is really bad. Service staffs damn rude. Food not fresh. Soup all diluted. Tried this place twice and gave me food poisoning twice. Eat at ur own risk.

address: 12 Jiak Chuan Road Singapore 089265 Singapore
comment: Updating to five stars. Truly a one of a kind place in Singapore. Their flavors are in point. Excellent cocktail menu to boot. Great ambience as well with all three floors having a distinct vibe. Get the goat curry and any dish which comes with the curried avocado. You won't be disappointed.

address: 12 Jiak Chuan Road Singapore 089265 Singapore
comment: Elegant décor (especially the upper floors). Nice African ambient music. Friendly service from a waitress with a brand new iPhone 11 Pro Max. We were the only guests for lunch on a weekday, yet the food took 30 minutes to come out. It is good, but portions are small, for the price (around $30++). Mobutu's heirs can afford to come to Utu, but not Mobutu's mob.

address: 12 Jiak Chuan Road Singapore 089265 Singapore
comment: Wonderful breakfast experience! Loved the chicken peanut curry and the speciality coffees. Staff was attentive and polite. Will definite be back again to check out their dinner scene.

address: 12 Jiak Chuan Road Singapore 089265 Singapore
comment: This is an absolutely fantastic place to go for breakfast. Their coffee is amazing, so be sure to order some of their specialty ones. I don't remember the name of it, but one had salted peanut butter on the rim of the cup and was really good. All of their breakfast items were excellent. Even if you just go for a coffee, be sure to order the little coconut donuts to go with. It's an easy walk from the main street in Chinatown called Tajong Pagar. Plus, the AC is nice and frosty  :)

address: 74 Neil Rd Singapore 088839 Singapore
comment: I enjoyed it. Bit of a surprise as I didn't know about this place, happened to walk by it when hungry.I walked in on a weekday lunch hour and found the place just opened for the day. Ordered the Avocado Toast dish and an iced americano then took a seat out in the garden patio area.They brought out the plate and it was just beautiful to look at, almost didn't want to eat it. This easily was the best tasting (and looking) Avocado Toast I've ever eaten. Highly recommend.Although having the main entrance on the side street is a bit of a nuisance. Otherwise it's a great cafe to hang and grab a bite!

address: 74 Neil Rd Singapore 088839 Singapore
comment: Great spot for a delicious bite to eat, breakfast, brunch, or lunch. Nice ambiance on the front patio, and an upstairs area with sitcom for the hot days.The food doesn't disappoint, and lots of greenery growing on the modern cement walls.

address: 74 Neil Rd Singapore 088839 Singapore
comment: Very chill ambiance with beautiful aesthetics. The food here is delicious, and they had a lot on their menu that I wanted to try. We went around brunch time and my husband got the soft shell crab burger. It was very tasty. I got the salmon tartine which was beautifully presented and equally as delicious.

address: 74 Neil Rd Singapore 088839 Singapore
comment: Looks great from the pics and menu online. We arrived and got a seat right away, however when we ordered, most things were sold out and the waitress stated that our food would take 50 min (Eggs and French toast) - why it would take so long boggles my mind. We decided to order drinks and leave. Bad business if they have such a problem w/cook times and turning tables.

address: 74 Neil Rd Singapore 088839 Singapore
comment: the place is absolutely beautiful - everything from interior design and the way each dish is plated. great attention to details, and the food tasted great too!will definitely come back to try more

address: 74 Neil Rd Singapore 088839 Singapore
comment: Although the place is quite crowded on weekends, the great service and ambience makes up for it! There is not GST/service charge so you pay whatever is on the menu. The outside of the cafe makes for a good backdrop for outfit photos too.

address: 19 Bukit Pasoh Road Singapore 089833 Singapore
comment: You can really feel a connection with the staff here, you enter a cosy and warm cafe that serves excellent food and drinks.Pros: Books, pool table, cigars and great whisky. Cons: Not closer to my home

address: 19 Bukit Pasoh Road Singapore 089833 Singapore
comment: We visited this place because we read about their Truffles promotion. The decor certainly is very impressive with books neatly arranged from wall to wall and old phones decorated at various locations. The ambience is great for catch up with friends over a drink. We've ordered our main courses all from the promo menu and truffle Parmesan fries. It took close to 20 mins before the fries arrived followed by pasta and burger. The Pork neck grill took another 10 mins to be delivered. Sadly, the burger and the Pork neck was more salty than needed while the pasta is blend. We are more sad that with all the truffle shavings on the pasta and pork neck, we can't smell the truffles. Which is very unusual as this is not the first time we've had truffle dishes. Even with the promotion, each dish is about $28. And for that price, I don't see the value when I have the 3 small pieces of pork neck done like schnitzels, topped with creamy sauce and potato chips that occupied half of the plate. We couldn't finish our food because I get tired chewing the pork neck and the pasta was too blend to warrant anymore consumption. The saving grace is the burger because it's not too big and, the parmesan fries has a very nice truffle mayo dip. I really want this place to work out better for customers because they are in a very nice location and the decor is great! I re

address: 19 Bukit Pasoh Road Singapore 089833 Singapore
comment: We were on our way to another cafe but spotted The Reading Room enroute. The charming facade looks cozy and enticed us to make a quick stop to view the place.We ended up staying for an hour and a half!Very cozy atmosphere with unique, vintage-like decoration. The coffee was average in quality but the atmosphere was the pull factor for us to return the next time.Book lovers will rejoice as the place is a good, quiet hide-out from the busy world to have a cuppa and to have a good reading session. For those who want a place to chill out with friends and catch-up, there's a bigger seating area at the back for big groups. Board games and card games are also available and placed discreetly on the bookshelves - the trick is to be the first to find them!Will definitely recommend this place to friends.

address: 19 Bukit Pasoh Road Singapore 089833 Singapore
comment: The Reading Room is really an interesting quirky cafe for some good drinks & reading time. We visited this cafe for a Sunday brunch after making a reservation, although the reservation was not a necessity! The moment you step inside the cafe, all the books arranged give you a very good vibe & make you feel you are in a library. They have lot of books of varied interests. We saw some of them even working on laptops or reading books for hours. The staff is really very friendly. One cannot visit this place with less time as it's a laid back cafe vibe with slow service. We ordered Eggs Benedict with portobello & Parmesan crisps and Smashed Avocado with Smoked salmon with Matcha latte & orange juice. While Matcha & juice was tasty & fresh, the food was bland. The food was very mediocre, no taste but it was fresh. This restaurant can be a gem only with better food service, hence did not deserve the 5 star. Overall it's an amazing place to read some books over coffee/tea with no time constraint!

comment: This is by far one of the most interesting places I've seen in Singapore... Set up to look like a library, The Reading Room has a varied selection of books to read (and to purchase) while being a full functioning café. I only went for afternoon drinks and was delightfully surprised by very nice happy hour offerings, on glasses of red and white wine as well as on beers, and other drinks. It did look like it had a nice brunch menu, and their burger offerings for dinner looked quite nice. At around 6:30 PM however, they shut off most of the lights, which I think was a real mood killer. No need to have lighting resembling that of a sketchy club, when you are in a nice café where people want to go to talk each other, and in fact, see each other too.
